Black hole

**Edited <time datetime="2013-06-21T21:05:50Z" title="06/21/2013 09:05  PM" data-short="11 yr">June 21, 2013</time> by willwolvescry**

I don't know what that is supposed to be, so here.

![Anime-Couples-anime-couples-27914024-1280-800.jpg](http://images5.fanpop.com/image/photos/27900000/Anime-Couples-anime-couples-27914024-1280-800.jpg)
It doesn't even remotely resemble a black hole, and you didn't add the text until after I commented. <.<

> 
> It doesn't even remotely resemble a black hole, and you didn't add the text until after I commented. <.<

google black hole you'll see

> 
> google black hole you'll see

A black hole is tiny and black (^^), and surrounded by something called an "accretion disc", a flattened cloud composed of gasses, bits of rock, and various other debris spiralling into the singularity. Your image is nowhere close to what it would look like.
Anyway. Impractical knife. Beat that.

![Knife.png](http://warisprejudice.com/wp-content/themes/prejudice/images/uploads/Knife.png)

Google black hole and it's the 2nd picture. The thing around it is a gravity lens

Anyway:

![Rusty_Knife_by_abaworlock.jpg](http://fc01.deviantart.net/fs70/f/2010/116/d/6/Rusty_Knife_by_abaworlock.jpg)

Yes, but the gravity lens wouldn't be observable in that manner. You'd actually only see the lens, since the black hole would not be "observable" from any range where you could see the lensing effect.

![Gladiatoria112.jpg](http://www.thearma.org/essays/SandB/Gladiatoria112.jpg)
